sentences.en: At a stroke, we would know who was profligate with company money and who was parsimonious.
sentences.cn: 这样我们一下子就能知道谁在恣意挥霍公司钱财,而谁节俭吝啬.

sentences.en: General manager Uli Hoeness is very risk - averse and strangely parsimonious in the transfer - market.
sentences.cn: 赫胖非常害怕风险,在转会市场上异乎寻常的吝啬.

sentences.en: German visitors are more parsimonious - their stays in London cost on average ￡77 a night.
sentences.cn: 德国游客在这方面相对节俭,他们在伦敦每晚住宿的平均消费为77英镑.

sentences.en: His parsimonious nature did not permit him to enjoy any luxuries.
sentences.cn: 他那吝啬的本性不容许他享受任何奢侈品.

sentences.en: Many scrollbars are quite parsimonious in doling out information to users.
sentences.cn: 很多滚动条都很吝啬,给用户传递的信息太少.

sentences.en: Parsimonious thrift relieved by few generous impulses.
sentences.cn: 吝啬的节俭架不住几次慷慨的冲动.

sentences.en: That's unlikely to happen unless the family fortune is huge or the beneficiaries are parsimonious.
sentences.cn: 然而,除非家族遗产数额巨大,或者这位遗产受益人出奇地节俭,否则是不可能做到这点的.

sentences.en: The appropriations committee, suddenly and ill - advisedly parsimonious, cut funds for assistance to the disadvantaged.
sentences.cn: 拨款委员会突然地和不明智地节俭地裁减对生活水平低的人的援助.

sentences.en: Yet the big brewers have been parsimonious in their marketing budgets, typically investing just 10% or so of their revenues, compared with around 15% at companies like Unilever and Procter &Gamble.
sentences.cn: 而啤酒厂商在销售预算上却很吝啬，仅投入收入的10％。 与之相比，联合利华和宝洁公司的投入则在15％左右。

words.tran_cn: 吝啬的；过于节俭的；质量差的

trans.tran_cn: 过分节俭的，吝啬的，小气的
